H. DOS S.;FIGUEIREDO, OTVIO HENRIQUE;FIGUEIREDO, OCTAVIO;FIGUEIREDO, O.;DOS SANTOS FIGUEIREDO, OTVIO HENRIQUE;Figueiredo, O;Figueiredo, Otvio H. S.

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Ps-doutorado na University of Birmingham, Inglaterra (2015/16). Bacharel (1991) e Mestre (1996) em Estatstica e Doutor em Administrao (2009) pela Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro (UFRJ). Diretor do Instituto COPPEAD de Administrao da Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro (desde 2022). Pesquisador PQ CNPq (desde 2018). Membro do Conselho Consultivo da European Foundation for Management Development (EFMD) for Latin American (desde 2022). Membro titular do G100 Brasil (desde 2022). Membro do Conselho Consultivo da Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB) for Latin American and Caribbean (desde 2023). Foi coordenador do programa de Ps-Graduao em Administrao do COPPEAD (2012/2014 e 2019/2021). Foi professor do Instituto de Matemtica da Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro (1998-2010). Foi professor da Universidade Federal Fluminense (1998). Os principais interesses de pesquisa so Econometria, Meio Ambiente e Energia, Energias Renovveis, Modelos de Previso, Modelos de Simulao e Negcios Internacionais.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Post-doctorate at the University of Birmingham, England (2015/16). Bachelor's degree (1991) and Master's degree (1996) in Statistics and a Ph.D. in Administration (2009) from the Federal University of Rio de Janeiro (UFRJ). Dean of the COPPEAD Institute of Administration at the Federal University of Rio de Janeiro (since 2022). Researcher PQ CNPq (since 2018). Member of the Advisory Council for Latin American of European Foundation for Management Development (EFMD) (since 2022). Full member of G100 Brazil (since 2022). Member of the Advisory Council for Latin American and Caribbean of the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB) (since 2023). Vice-dean of the Postgraduate Program in Administration at COPPEAD (2012/2014 and 2019/2021). Professor at the Institute of Mathematics at the Federal University of Rio de Janeiro (1998-2010). Professor at the Federal Fluminense University (1998). The main research interests are Econometrics, Environment and Energy, Renewable Energies, Forecasting Models, Simulation Models, and International Business.
